articles.title: Hamas accepts proposed deal for ceasefire with Israel and hostage release, Egyptian source says
articles.content: Senior Hamas official Basem Naim confirmed the group's approval on Facebook. Hamas said other Palestinian factions informed mediators of their approval also. Egypt and Qatar have been mediating between the sides with US support. Israeli officials believe 20 are alive.

articles.title: In cramped, sweaty Hong Kong, climate change is making things worse for the poorest
articles.content: On a sweltering summer afternoon in Hong Kong, Yeung Fong-yanâ€™s flat felt like an oven. Her 13-year-old grandson had just returned home from school, exhausted and drenched in sweat after climbing nine floors to reach their apartment

articles.title: SAF commences airdrop operations in Gaza, thanks Jordan for invitation
articles.content: The Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) has commenced airdrop operations to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza. The aid comprises medical supplies from the Ministry of Health, and food supplies from various non-governmental organisations (NGOs). The NGOs include Humanity Matters, Caritas Humanitarian Aid and Relief Initiative Singapore, Mercy Relief, and the Rahmatan Lil Alamin Foundation. These were coordinated through the Changi Regional Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief Coordination Centre.
